com.xith3d.scenegraph
Interface NodeUpdater

public interface NodeUpdater

Node updater interface is designed to allow special code to adjust a node's appearance if it is going to be rendered. This should *not* be used to adjust a transform since these methods are only called if the renderer has determined that the node is within view. This is a way of adjusting display only when necessary. An example would be a particle system, where you only want to acutally adjust the geometry if the particle system is within view.

Originally Coded by David Yazel on Nov 8, 2003 at 1:17:27 PM.

Method Summary
 boolean preRender(Transform3D viewTransform, Frustum frustum, Transform3D modelTransform, long time)
           
 

Method Detail

preRender

public boolean preRender(Transform3D viewTransform,
                         Frustum frustum,
                         Transform3D modelTransform,
                         long time)
Parameters:
viewTransform - Transform of the view
modelTransform - Current local to vworld transform
frustum - view frustum
time - frame time. Only applicable if a timer interface has been registered with the View
Returns:
True if this should be rendered, false if it should not.
